description: Two figures, one with a pickaxe, resembling Santa Claus, are descending into a deep, empty, V-shaped chasm. The irony lies in these festive-looking characters engaging in such a dangerous and seemingly pointless endeavor. Their descent into the barren gorge contrasts sharply with their typical association with abundance and giving. The scene suggests an absurd quest into nothingness, possibly a commentary on searching for something that doesn't exist. Their appearance and the desolate environment create a surreal juxtaposition.
caption: “Because it’s not there.”
